entry.title: Kenya 'Top Cup'
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 17.95 - 118.95 (8 variants)

Our Kenya 'Top Cup' is a winy, full-bodied and very intense coffee with exceptional bright, clean aroma. It features Kenya's distinctive blackcurrant flavor, with intense, winy acidity and an extra rich dark caramel flavor note added by the Nyeri region's exceptional terroir.

As with many of our past Top Cup selections, these peaberries are certified sustainably grown. They're produced by Othaya Co-op in Nyeri, where one thousand family farmers grow Heirloom Arabicas in red volcanic soil at 6000' elevation on the flanks of Mt. Kenya surrounding the Co-op's mill.

This 'Top Cup' coffee is processed with the incomparable attention to detail that makes Kenyan beans the world's finest. Farm families hand-pick their own fully ripe cherries and deliver them to the mill daily, to be pulped and washed using fresh mountain water from River Ichamama. When the washing process is finished the beans are sun dried, off the ground in net 'hammock' beds.

entry.title: Decaf Organic Mexico Mountain Water Process
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 15.95

Background
Just one look and taste of Barriques Decaf, and you know we’re coming from a very different place than other specialty roasters. We buy better beans because we’re determined that ALL our customers enjoy great coffee – crisp, rich and satisfying, and with ‘taste of place’ only possessed by sustainably-grown heirloom Arabica.

These beans are decaffeinated by the Mountain Water Process, the same natural decaffeination as Swiss Water. The decaffeination plant is new, with updated processes and controls that protect coffee flavor. We craft roast decaf the same way as our other coffees – in small batches with careful attention to the nuances that signal peak flavor development. Our Decafs are delicious, with cup quality, intensity and flavor to match our other specialty coffees!

Taste
This coffee is carefully sourced to withstand the extreme pressures of the natural decaffeination process resulting in natural flavor retention that is true of the bean. It is from an organically certified cooperative of nearly 2100 smallholders in the surrounding Oaxacan coffee regions of Costa, Sierra Sur, Mixteca, Cañada and Papaloapan.   It is a beautiful representation of the clean, mellow, comforting flavors of Mexican coffee.

entry.title: Guatemala Huehuetenango
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 11.95 - 93.00 (8 variants)

Finca La Providencia Palu, this week’s newcrop arrival, has a classic Huehue cup: crisp aroma with floral and spice notes, fresh, sweet orange acidity that doesn't overwhelm the jammy sweet chocolate midtone and a creamy, malty caramel finish note, the signature of fine Huehuetenango coffees.

La Providencia is owned and operated by Maximiliano Palacios (Max), a third generation coffee farmer. The name of the coffee, Palhu, is formed from a combination of the family name Palacios and the department of Huehuetenango.

entry.title: Eye Opener
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 13.95 - 92.95 (8 variants)

Background
Barriques blends have rock-solid flavor and intensity every day of the year. Our blending secret? No shortcuts!  We create blends around specific flavor profiles and work every day to keep them tasting their best. We manage blends the rigorous, old-fashioned way, tasting and tweaking to maintain peak flavor, intensity and balance. We use great beans, too – the same sustainably-grown Heirloom Arabicas as our single origin coffees. Blend with less intense ‘blender beans’ to save a few cents? Not here.

Taste
The Eye Opener is a blend of Heirloom Arabicas from both the New World as well as Africa, including Ethiopia Yrgacheffe.  It is a bright, energizing breakfast-type blend, that has a pleasant medium body, clean sweet flavor and a brisk coffee aroma.

entry.title: Motor Moka
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 13.95 - 93.00 (8 variants)

Background
Motor Moka was the first blend we developed when we began roasting our own coffee almost a decade ago. It served as the foundation around which all our other blends would rotate around in terms of quality and consistency. 

Taste
Motor Moka is designed to really keep your engine running!  It is composed of a blend of washed Central American beans, including Columbian and Costa Rican.  We roast and blend Motor Moka to be a calm, bright all-day blend, designed to be as smooth a ride as can be.

entry.title: Blackstrap
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 11.95 - 92.95 (8 variants)

Background
Blackstrap features dry processed Ethiopia Natural and Brazil with deep roasted Sumatra coffee.

Taste
A very rich, silky mouthfeel highlights this sweet, nutty and deep-toned blend.

entry.title: Sumatra Mandheling #1
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 13.95 - 93.00 (8 variants)

Coffeeheads love Sumatra’s incredible aroma, savory flavor and rich mouthfeel. Roaster-type coffeeheads further cherish Sumatra because it’s an awesome blender; the deep, low-toned flavor provides a rock-solid base and, far beyond any other coffee, Sumatra makes blends taste like more. So, what’s not to love?

Sumatra’s extremely complex flavor features heavy body, low acidity, notes of spice and bittersweet chocolate, and a savory, ‘foresty’ character of woodsmoke and clean, moist earth. The penetrating flavor is perceived from the middle of the mouth to far back into the throat, resonating even into the back of the sinuses. It all comes from Sumatra’s terroir – the combination of climate, altitude, native Heirloom coffees and bean preparation that only occurs here.

Our Sumatra beans are 100% Sumatran Mandheling Lintong Dolok Sanggul Heirloom Arabica. Our importer has direct purchased these beans from his extended family, who are coffee growers in and around the Dolok, Sanggul and Lake Toba villages in Northern Sumatra. Lintong is a general name for Sumatra Mandheling coffees from the interior mountains south of Medan, Sumatra’s major city.

entry.title: Sumatra Dark Roast
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 15.45 - 77.25 (8 variants)

Coffeeheads love Sumatra’s incredible aroma, savory flavor and rich mouthfeel. Roaster-type coffeeheads further cherish Sumatra because it’s an awesome blender; the deep, low-toned flavor provides a rock-solid base and, far beyond any other coffee, Sumatra makes blends taste like more. So, what’s not to love?

Our Sumatra Dark Roast features smooth, heavy body and a massive mouthfeel. It’s dominated by rich, dark chocolate flavor with notes of forest and clean earth, supported – not overwhelmed – by the rustic roasty, smoky character that’s unmistakeably Dark Sumatra. More than any other origin, Sumatra’s ‘taste of place’ is a product of its climate, and especially the method of bean preparation unique to Sumatra known as Giling Basah.

Our Sumatra beans are 100% Sumatran Mandheling Lintong Dolok Sanggul Heirloom Arabica. Our importer has direct purchased these beans from his extended family, who are coffee growers in and around the Dolok, Sanggul and Lake Toba villages in Northern Sumatra. Lintong is a general name for Sumatra Mandheling coffees from the interior mountains south of Medan, Sumatra’s major city.

entry.title: Cold Brew Coffee Blend
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 13.95 - 92.95 (8 variants)

Our Barriques Cold Brew Blend is back!

Our Cold Brew Coffee Blend is made with 100% sustainably-grown Heirloom Arabica beans.

Both Regular and Decaf Cold Brew Coffee Blend deliver flavor that stays rich and sweet served straight, mixed with milk or with whatever flavors you like. This special blend delivers excellent mouthfeel while being full-bodied with mellow flavor and notes of chocolate and nuts.

The cold brew process we use makes a ready-to-use concentrate that assures full coffee flavor and rich texture with low acidity. It’s also ready for immediate refreshment – a clear advantage over hot-brewed coffee on ice which has watery, acidy flavor.

Cold brewing’s easy too. Steep coarse ground beans in cold water for 8–12 hours, then filter off the ready to use concentrate. It’s ready to use immediately or store refrigerated for up to 2 weeks. Make it at home using a French Press – just ask for a free recipe!

entry.title: Smokejumper Dark
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 14.45 - 96.00 (8 variants)

You know you crave the Dark Side, that deep, smoky nectar you taste, smell, feel – heck, almost chew. Sink your fangs deep into our Smokejumper Dark Roast! Created for lovers of dark coffee, Smokejumper is exceptionally rich and heavy-bodied, a huge mouthful of flavor inspired by fine bittersweet chocolate.

Smokejumper Dark is a roast for which we use a blend of beans. We roast lush, sweet Colombian coffee and incomparably deep, smoky Sumatra to maximize the roasty brown sugars and fruit flavors, teasing out a piquant counterpoint of licorice, leather and smoky incense notes. In dark roasts the flavor and mouthfeel delivered by the roast itself is the dominant character. The darker the roast, the more roast (generic) flavors gain influence, eventually dominating over origin flavor. That’s a different objective than roasts we use for origins, where lighter roast levels are tailored to highlight each origin’s best attributes. Patient, hand-crafted roasting maximizes Smokejumper Dark’s bittersweet, smoky flavor with no harsh or burned note, the key to its ‘iron-fist, velvet-glove’ appeal. In dark roasting, time is the underused resource; with the right beans, a bit of extra patience with a roast achieves coffee with big body and mouthfeel AND a soft, sweet texture – the critical element that sets apart Smokejumper Dark Roast

entry.title: Full-Bore
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 13.95 - 93.00 (8 variants)

Background
Barriques blends have rock-solid flavor and intensity every day of the year. Our blending secret? No shortcuts!  We create blends around specific flavor profiles and work every day to keep them tasting their best. We manage blends the rigorous, old-fashioned way, tasting and tweaking to maintain peak flavor, intensity and balance. We use great beans, too – the same sustainably-grown Heirloom Arabicas as our single origin coffees. Blend with less intense ‘blender beans’ to save a few cents? Not here.

Taste
Full-Bore is a deep and very full-bodied blend that’s rich with dark sweet chocolate and roasty flavor, and has an excellent spicy aroma. It’s a blend of medium and dark roasts featuring Ethiopia and Brazil naturally processed beans, and Sumatra Dark Roast.

entry.title: Merchants Blend
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 13.95 - 93.00 (8 variants)

Merchants Blend marries bright, crisp New World coffee with rich and bittersweet dark roast. The classic interplay of light and dark roast flavor is known worldwide as the Viennese Blend. It’s the original European coffee tradition, and like all grand traditions, Merchants Blend begins with a legend and a hero…

...In 1683, when the Hapsburg emperor’s army liberated Vienna from the Turks, they found sacks of strange beans. Thinking they were camel feed they set some afire, and the scent of roasting coffee brought a young officer, our hero, on the run. As a former Turkish prisoner he’s the only European in Vienna who knows the secret of coffee’s bold flavor and vitality.

So, our hero boldly meets his destiny… He cons the general into giving him the beans, then gets himself cashiered and opens the original Viennese coffeehouse. Our enterprising hero blends those dark, burned beans with lighter roast, brews them and adds sweet whipped cream – and the Viennese Blend, Vienna’s Golden Era and European coffee tradition are born… and the rest is history!

Merchants Blend is a traditional Viennese coffee, seamlessly blending crisp, sweet New World and buttery Colombian with our Smokejumper Dark Roast. It’s aromatic, full bodied and elegantly smooth, with a light, smoky tang and a rich, bittersweet chocolate finish. Enjoy Merchants Blend; it’s equally at home as an elegant dinner companion or around the campfire with friends!

entry.title: Colombia Dark
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 13.95 - 92.95 (8 variants)

Background
Really good Colombian like our “Cordillera Central” is one of the best reasons to love coffee! Colombian coffees are celebrated for having “more” and compared to the straightforward bright, clean cup of other New World beans, they sure do… more lush character and body, a richer aroma, and more sweet chocolate, lush fruit flavors.   These beans come from steep hillsides of rich volcanic soil, with heirloom Arabicas grown in shade at 1500 to 1800 meters altitude high above the Cauca River, an excellent year-round source of fresh spring water. Only ripe cherries are harvested by hand and sun-dried by individual farmers.

Taste
A darker take on our Colombian Coffee, the Colombia Dark is a full and buttery dark roast, with a deep spicy twist. Like rich bittersweet dark chocolate, this Colombia Dark makes a compelling argument to join the dark side.

entry.title: North Beach Italian Roast
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 13.95 - 93.00 (8 variants)

Say “heavy, man” to our darkest coffee! North Beach Italian Roast is a genuine San Francisco “fog cutter” – a powerful full-dark roast that’ll break on through even your darkest, bleakest night.

Roaster Rob’s salute to his West Coast coffee roots, North Beach Italian Roast maximizes the spicy, bittersweet flavor and rich, heavy body from African, Indonesian and New World beans. Our patient craft roast achieves a full-dark roast with big body and mouthfeel AND a soft, sweet texture. Never harsh/totally mellow!

entry.title: Bali Kintamani Natural
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 15.95 - 105.95 (8 variants)

Background
The Bali Kintamani Natural is in the house! This USDA Certified Organic and Rainforest Alliance Certified coffee is a true Barriques customer favorite.

Taste
The Bali Kintamani is a coffee with a true sweet spot.  It features a whirl of warmly intense, brandy-like flavor of plum, cherry and nectarine. The amazing fruit highlights an extraordinarily clean Indonesian cup that’s deep-toned and aromatic and savory. There’s nothing else like this beautiful fruit bomb of a coffee!

entry.title: Brazil Reserva Natural
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 13.95 - 92.95 (8 variants)

Background
Brazil Reserva Natural is grown by sustainable farming practices. Processing is by the natural method; the sweet coffee pulp mingles with beans during drying, adding sweetness and rich, silky mouthfeel. Brazil’s heirloom Arabica types, Bourbon & Mundo Novo, are so in synch with the wonderful terroir they pump the beans full of carbs. Our craft roasting method converts them into this coffee with amazingly sweet, deep chocolate flavor

Taste
Brazil Reserva Natural is a mellow, sweet-cupping coffee full of nutty dark chocolate flavor. Coffee pros call it a soft cup, with a pleasing, mellow mouthfeel that also greatly aids blending. In fact, we like it so well, we use it as the backbone of our Forge Espresso.  As the song says, there’s an awful lot of coffee in Brazil…and like the Bossa Nova, our Brazil Reserva Natural is rich, nostalgic and bittersweet – mellow and satisfying every time!  

 


.

entry.title: Colombia Cordillera Central
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 13.95 - 92.95 (8 variants)

Background
Really good Colombian like “Cordillera Central” is one of the best reasons to love coffee! Colombian coffees are celebrated for having “more” and compared to the straightforward bright, clean cup of other New World beans, they sure do… more lush character and body, a richer aroma, and more sweet chocolate, lush fruit flavors.

The number two world producer of Arabica, Colombia’s quality reputation was born with beans from the “MAM” provinces (Medellin, Armenia, Manizales) in the heart of the Cordillera Central range. The rugged mountains are the secret of a unique climate responsible for Colombia’s excellent coffee. The Cordillera intercepts weather from the Pacific, Atlantic and Caribbean, constantly circulating warm tropical air up the slopes to coffee farms at even the highest altitude. The Cordillera spans Colombia from farthest south to well north of the Equator, making it one of very few coffee areas in the world producing multiple crops of fresh beans yearly.

These beans come from steep hillsides of rich volcanic soil, with heirloom Arabicas grown in shade at 1500 to 1800 meters altitude high above the Cauca River, an excellent year-round source of fresh spring water. Only ripe cherries are harvested by hand and sun-dried by individual farmers.

Taste
Our roast is tailored to emphasize Colombia’s signature attributes; full body, sweet, rich cocoa and plum flavor and voluptuous aroma. The cup has silky, buttery texture and a tangy walnut oil finish that’s a hallmark of great Colombians.

entry.title: Ethiopia Yrgacheffe
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 14.45 - 96.00 (8 variants)

Background
Coffee is the central element of Ethiopian culture and hospitality – where the word “coffee” originated, and where people first turned beans into beverage by learning how to roast. An invitation to have coffee in Ethiopia is a timeless way to pass an afternoon! Ethiopia’s high, wild forests and remote dry mountain terraces are the epicenter of the specialty coffee revolution. The original home of Coffea Arabica, the high-altitude branch of coffee’s family tree, Ethiopia is coffee’s cradle of diversity with over 400 wild Arabica strains identified and hundreds more still to be discovered.

Taste
Yrgacheffe, Ethiopia’s most prized coffee, is used to celebrate Ethiopian life’s biggest moments. Prepared from the highest-grown beans grown in the southern mountains along the Great Rift, Yrgacheffe coffees are organically grown, painstakingly hand-picked, fully sun dried and immaculately prepared by washed processing. The Yrgacheffe cup, transcendentally clean, bright, sweet and elegant, lures you back again and again. It is medium-full bodied with intoxicating spicy aroma, Yrgacheffe’s vibrant, complex flavors of sweet lemon zest, lavender, anise and spice are like no other coffee.

entry.title: The Forge Espresso
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 13.95 - 93.00 (8 variants)

Our signature espresso is a deliciously rich, complex melange of savory fruit and nut flavors crafted from heirloom Arabica beans.

entry.title: Downshift Decaf Mountain Water Process
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 14.45 - 96.00 (8 variants)

Downshift Decaf is our breakfast-type Decaf blend. We use natural decafs from the New World, Africa and the Pacific Islands to build a blend with crisp, energizing aroma, medium body and lots of bright fruit notes.

Just one look and taste of Barriques decaf coffee, and you know we’re coming from a very different place than other specialty roasters. We buy better beans because we’re determined that ALL our customers enjoy great coffee – crisp, rich and satisfying, and with ‘taste of place’ only possessed by sustainably-grown heirloom Arabica.

Our beans are decaffeinated by the Mountain Water Process, the same natural decaffeination as Swiss Water. The decaffeination plant is new, with updated processes and controls that protect coffee flavor. We craft roast decaf the same way as our other coffees – in small batches with careful attention to the nuances that signal peak flavor development. Our Decafs are delicious, with cup quality, intensity and flavor to match our other specialty coffees!

entry.title: Decaf Merchants Blend Mountain Water Process
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 14.45 - 96.00 (8 variants)

Decaf Merchants Blend is a rich and satisfying medium-full bodied blend with roasty, lightly spicy flavor. We use natural decafs from Colombia, Sumatra and our Decaf Smokejumper Dark Roast to make a blend with a roasty flavor notes and rich, satisfying body and mouthfeel.

Just one look and taste of a Barriques decaf and you know we’re coming from a very different place than other specialty roasters. We buy better beans because we’re determined that ALL our customers enjoy great coffee – crisp, rich and satisfying, and with ‘taste of place’ only possessed by sustainably-grown heirloom Arabica.

Our beans are decaffeinated by the Mountain Water Process, the same natural decaffeination as Swiss Water. The decaffeination plant is new, with updated processes and controls that protect coffee flavor. We craft roast decaf the same way as our other coffees – in small batches with careful attention to the nuances that signal peak flavor development. Our Decafs are delicious, with cup quality, intensity and flavor to match our other specialty coffees!

entry.title: Decaf Colombia Mountain Water Process
entry.summary:
Vendor: Barriques Coffee
Type: Coffee
Price: 13.95 - 92.95 (8 variants)

Background
Just one look and taste of Barriques Decaf, and you know we’re coming from a very different place than other specialty roasters. We buy better beans because we’re determined that ALL our customers enjoy great coffee – crisp, rich and satisfying, and with ‘taste of place’ only possessed by sustainably-grown heirloom Arabica. These beans are grown in Huila, one of the finest growing areas of Colombia’s southern Cordillera Central range, and produced by a small mill run by the Valencia family. For over 30 years the Valencias have been a mainstay for the best specialty coffees from Huila.

Our beans are decaffeinated by the Mountain Water Process, the same natural decaffeination as Swiss Water. The decaffeination plant is new, with updated processes and controls that protect coffee flavor. We craft roast decaf the same way as our other coffees – in small batches with careful attention to the nuances that signal peak flavor development. Our Decafs are delicious, with cup quality, intensity and flavor to match our other specialty coffees!

Taste
Our Colombia Mountain Water Decaf is medium-bodied with a smooth, buttery mouthfeel and sweet chocolate and walnut flavor notes. The excellent flavor and rich, nutty finish will have you reaching for a second cup.
